content.raw:
I agree with Jose. We shouldn't modify tests to make them run faster if that also bypasses standard conditions.

It would be nice to modify (add to?) the physics tests so that they run both conditions: the normal time, and the fast time. It's possible to run without physics throttled, so it's a valid test case.
content.html:
I agree with Jose. We shouldn't modify tests to make them run faster if that also bypasses standard conditions.

It would be nice to modify (add to?) the physics tests so that they run both conditions: the normal time, and the fast time. It's possible to run without physics throttled, so it's a valid test case.
